com.budjb.requestbuilder
[Groovy] Class RequestBuilder

java.lang.Object
  com.budjb.requestbuilder.RequestBuilder

class RequestBuilder

The RequestBuilder abstracts the underlying code to build a Jersey Client request into a closure.

Authors:
Bud Byrd

basic auth password

basic auth user name
boolean binaryResponse

Whether the caller expects a binary return.
java.lang.Object body

Body of the request - only useful on POST or PUT.
java.lang.Integer chunkSize

Size (in bytes) to chunk the request.
java.lang.Integer connectionTimeout

The Connection Timeout for the Client.
java.lang.String contentType

Content-Type header.
boolean convertJson

Whether to attempt to slurp JSON automatically.
boolean convertXML

Attempt to use xmlslurpler to parse xml.
java.util.Map cookies

Cookies to include with the request.
boolean debug

Whether to log the request and response.
boolean encodeGzip

Encode the request with gzip compression.
boolean followRedirects

Whether to automatically follow redirects.
java.util.Map form

Form parameters
java.util.Map headers

Headers
boolean ignoreInvalidSSL

Whether to ignore SSL cert validation.
java.util.Map query

Query parameters.
boolean rawClientResponse

If true, do not response handling, and return the raw response object.
java.lang.Integer readTimeout

The Read Timeout for the Client.
boolean skipStatusCheck

If true, do not check the response status code, and thus don't throw an exception for codes > 2xx.
java.lang.Object uri

The URI to hit.
boolean useBasicAuth

If true uses BasicAuth

Property Detail

accept

java.lang.String accept
Accept header.

basicAuthPassword

java.lang.String basicAuthPassword
basic auth password

basicAuthUserName

java.lang.String basicAuthUserName
basic auth user name

binaryResponse

boolean binaryResponse
Whether the caller expects a binary return. If true, the returned object will be a byte array. Note that this is a workaround to jersey not providing automatic content conversion based on mime type.

body

java.lang.Object body
Body of the request - only useful on POST or PUT.

chunkSize

java.lang.Integer chunkSize
Size (in bytes) to chunk the request.

connectionTimeout

java.lang.Integer connectionTimeout
The Connection Timeout for the Client.

contentType

java.lang.String contentType
Content-Type header.

convertJson

boolean convertJson
Whether to attempt to slurp JSON automatically.

convertXML

boolean convertXML
Attempt to use xmlslurpler to parse xml.

cookies

java.util.Map cookies
Cookies to include with the request.

debug

boolean debug
Whether to log the request and response.

encodeGzip

boolean encodeGzip
Encode the request with gzip compression.

followRedirects

boolean followRedirects
Whether to automatically follow redirects.

form

java.util.Map form
Form parameters Note that if this is set, this is used and body is ignored.

headers

java.util.Map headers
Headers

ignoreInvalidSSL

boolean ignoreInvalidSSL
Whether to ignore SSL cert validation.

query

java.util.Map query
Query parameters.

rawClientResponse

boolean rawClientResponse
If true, do not response handling, and return the raw response object.

readTimeout

java.lang.Integer readTimeout
The Read Timeout for the Client.

skipStatusCheck

boolean skipStatusCheck
If true, do not check the response status code, and thus don't throw an exception for codes > 2xx.

uri

java.lang.Object uri
The URI to hit. Can either be a String or an URI.

useBasicAuth

boolean useBasicAuth
If true uses BasicAuth

getClient

private com.sun.jersey.api.client.Client getClient()
Creates the jersey client instance. This method is required to handle ignoring SSL cert validation. Code to implement this is based on information gathered from: * http://stackoverflow.com/questions/6047996/ignore-self-signed-ssl-cert-using-jersey-client * http://stackoverflow.com/questions/2145431/https-using-jersey-client
Returns:
Configured jersey client

getConfig

private groovy.util.ConfigObject getConfig()
Retrieve Jersey RequestBuilder portion of the Configuration.

getRequestBody

private java.lang.Object getRequestBody()
Returns the body entity to send with the request. This function will check if values were entered for a POST form, and if present build the form object and return it, ignoring any body that was added. If no form values are found, body is returned.
Returns:

handleResponse

private java.lang.Object handleResponse(com.sun.jersey.api.client.ClientResponse response)
Checks for bad status codes, and does auto conversion of responses if necessary.
Parameters:
response - Response object to handle.
Returns:
The content of the response.
